title: Right shift not recognised when using Chrome Remote Desktop
author: Kellett
body_snippet:
When using Chrome remote desktop to connect to a windows 10 machine running mRemoteNG the right shift key isn't recognised (Tested in RDP)

## Expected Behavior
Pressing the right shift key should send the key to the remote connection

## Current Behavior
Nothing happens

## Possible Solution
<!--- Not obligatory, but suggest a fix/reason for the bug, -->

iterations.description: mRemoteNG keyboard hooks likely consume or mishandle VK_RSHIFT (0xA1) differently from VK_LSHIFT, causing Chrome Remote Desktop to not receive right-shift events.

comments.author: Kellett
comments.snippet:
For anyone else getting bothered by this issue I have a workaround that works for me (YMMV)

[Microsoft PowerTools](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys) since v0.18.0 has a keyboard remapper. I've used this to remap "Right Shift" to "Left Shift". This has removed a lot of my frustration.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1553850/84022211-c9363300-a97d-11ea-84ef-83cc02dadd94.png)

comments.author: blu3mania
comments.snippet:
Another workaround that does not involve other tools. You can just configure key mappings in Chrome Remote Desktop and map right shift (ShiftRight) to left shift (ShiftLeft):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59448289/178769817-fe9ed291-16d1-4eaa-8739-26c1aa939d0b.png)

comments.author: GeonungYoun1
comments.snippet:
Change setting of your host computer not local computer. (In case of, Window 11)
You should set it on  [Previous Version of Microsoft IME], and it should definitely work fine.
It is quite difficult to find that options. you can find it in search bar - [IME] - language option - keyboard option of microsoft.

comments.author: mak-ando
comments.snippet: Just encountered the issue myself. Realised I have Chinese input method turned on in the local computer. Toggling back to English solves the problem.

notes:
AI triage (claude): mRemoteNG keyboard hooks likely consume or mishandle VK_RSHIFT (0xA1) differently from VK_LSHIFT, causing Chrome Remote Desktop to not receive right-shift events.
Approach: Audit global keyboard hook handler for asymmetric left/right modifier key handling; ensure VK_RSHIFT passes through to child windows/processes the same as VK_LSHIFT.
